name: Spot-billed Pelican
description: It has gray-white coloration and a small crest on the crown. The pouch is pink with gray spots. During the breeding season, the upper beak also has gray spots, and the bare skin around the eyes turns pink.
spread_note: Found from Pakistan through India to Indonesia, nesting only in India, Sri Lanka, and Cambodia.
food_note: Fish, occasionally other small aquatic animals
proportions: Body length 125–150 cm, including beak 28–35 cm; weight 5 kg
reproduction: Females typically lay 3 eggs, incubated for 30 days.
attractions: It nests in colonies in tree crowns, with pairs rebuilding nests annually at the same site. It often associates with other birds, especially storks.
projects_note: One of the rarest pelican species, now found in only a fraction of its original range. Thanks to effective protection, their numbers are slowly rising in some areas.
